page.title: 12Game-keeping,Cortachy.
page.content: In February{ wild pheasants}are caught and small pens erected for laying.Pheasant drives are improved by trimming trees and sowing gamecrop. Egg laying starts in April.The eggs are put in incubators and hatch in 24 days.Gradually the{chicks}are moved from heated to cooler pens until as 8 weeks old{pullets}they are released to larger pens in several woods and are fed to keep them close-by.Shooting,by paying guests,begins at the end of November and continues until the beginning of February when the whole procedure starts again. Throughout the year{rabbits}and {game predators}are kept under control. {Roe}and{Red deer}are stalked at the appropriate months of the year.{Grouse and{partridge}are shot in the late summer.
